posts.post_content: man, the "wisdom" mechanic really sucked. 9 times out of ten i'd rather have naturalize; or [wear away](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=wear away) if i'm playing an arcane deck.

Posted By: luca_barelli (4/20/2011 10:21:15 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is one of my favorites that I just can't ever find a justifying reason to play with. I really like the cantrip effect, but it's hard to make fit into a deck. This spell can only really kill small artifacts too, and when played with a bunch of spirit guys you want spells that are both proactive and reactive.
  
   
I like it and I frequently pull it out as a questionable inclusion into random green decks, but it never seems to make the final cut.
posts.html:
This card is one of my favorites that I just can't ever find a justifying reason to play with. I really like the cantrip effect, but it's hard to make fit into a deck. This spell can only really kill small artifacts too, and when played with a bunch of spirit guys you want spells that are both proactive and reactive.

I like it and I frequently pull it out as a questionable inclusion into random green decks, but it never seems to make the final cut.

posts.post_content:
**Aaron’s Random Card Comment of the Day #25, 10/29/10**   
   
This card went through quite a few iterations.
  
   
1) ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) Instant / Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If you have 7 cards in hand, destroy an additional target artifact or enchantment.
  
2) ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) Instant – Arcane / Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If you have more cards in hand than an opponent, destroy an additional target artifact or enchantment.
  
3) ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) Instant – Arcane / Destroy target artifact or enchantment with converted mana cost less than or equal to the number of cards in your hand.
  
   
My Multiverse comment on #3: “AF 7/1: I hate this.” Could have been for many reasons. Developer Randy Buehler added a mana to it.
  
   
4) ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) Instant – Arcane / Destroy target artifact or enchantment with converted mana cost less than or equal to the number of cards in your hand.
  
   
Designer Brian Tinsman’s Multiverse comment on #4: “BT 7/20: Wow this feels like a horrible version of [Naturalize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Naturalize). Can we... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

2) Instant – Arcane / Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If you have more cards in hand than an opponent, destroy an additional target artifact or enchantment.
3) Instant – Arcane / Destroy target artifact or enchantment with converted mana cost less than or equal to the number of cards in your hand.

My Multiverse comment on #3: “AF 7/1: I hate this.” Could have been for many reasons. Developer Randy Buehler added a mana to it.

4) Instant – Arcane / Destroy target artifact or enchantment with converted mana cost less than or equal to the number of cards in your hand.

posts.post_content:
Is it just me, or is the typesetting on this card a little... Unintuitive? I'd assumed the first sentence ended after "enchantment", and had to go back to figure out why there was a line break before "Draw a card".  
  
What's worse, I like my version better...
posts.html:

Posted By: RedKutai (6/16/2011 11:49:08 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This would be a much better card if it let you Naturalise regardless of hand size but drew you a card if you met the wisdom requirements. In fact, that's a much more build-around-able wisdom design; it feeds other cards that do a similar thing and maintains your hand size, pretty much what 'wisdom' is all about.
posts.html:
This would be a much better card if it let you Naturalise regardless of hand size but drew you a card if you met the wisdom requirements. In fact, that's a much more build-around-able wisdom design; it feeds other cards that do a similar thing and maintains your hand size, pretty much what 'wisdom' is all about.
